abstract: American service members at Incirlik Air Base in Turkey describe what it was like being at base during attempted military coup; many are fearful that military campaign against Islamic State will weaken if Turkish officials--some of whom are accusing United States of playing role in coup--kick Americans off base.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Senior American military officers at Incirlik Air Base scrambled to figure out what was happening, and reverberations were felt directly at the installation.
snippet: Senior American military officers at Incirlik Air Base scrambled to figure out what was happening, and reverberations were felt directly at the installation....

headline.main: ‘There’s Something Going On in Turkey,’ U.S. Colonel Was Told During Coup Attempt
headline.print_headline: Officers Scrambled at U.S. Base as Coup Unfolded Around Them
